newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil March coffee exports 1.53 mln bags - Febec.
newsitem.headline: Brazil March coffee exports 1.53 mln bags - Febec.

text.p: Brazil exported 1.53 million 60-kg bags of coffee, ground and beans, in March, above an adjusted February figure of 1.10 million bags, said Brazilian Federation of Coffee Exporters (Febec).
Previously, Febec had estimated February exports at 1.09 million bags.
The March total is also more than twice the 583,497 bags exported in the same month in 1996.
Brazilian exports so far this year have reached 3.89 million bags, more than twice the 1.77 million bags shipped in the first three months of 1996.
Revenue more than doubled to $620.65 million from $250.57 million earned in January/March 1996. Revenue last month was $290.64 million against $89.18 million in March last year.
The average price per bag rose to $190.09 in March compared with $153.29 in February, Febec said.
Of March's total, 1.51 million bags were arabica coffee, while shipments of conillon reached 17,000 bags. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
